title: Salman Khan Didn't 'Allow' Sangeeta Bijlani To Wear Short Clothes, Actress Says 'I'm Not Afraid Now' - News18
summary:
Salman Khan Didn't 'Allow' Sangeeta Bijlani To Wear Short Clothes, Actress Says 'I'm Not Afraid Now'

Date & Source: January 01, 2025, 16:30 IST - News18

Sangeeta Bijlani, a former Bollywood actress, recently revealed that during her relationship with Salman Khan, he didn't allow her to wear short clothes.

In an appearance on Indian Idol 15, when asked if she would have changed something in her career, she said, "Jo the na (mimics Salman) humare ex, I was very constricted. Matlab kapde yeh nahi pehanna, itne short nahi hone chahiye. Itna long hona chahiye, voh gale main‚Ä¶ I could not wear this kind of dress. Initially, I did but then I was not allowed to. So I was shy then, abhi main aisi nahi hoon. Abhi poori gundi hoon. I‚Äôm not afraid now, I was reserved then."

  1. Sangeeta Bijlani opens up about her relationship with Salman Khan.
  2. She revealed that Salman didn't allow her to wear short clothes during their relationship.
  3. She mimicked Salman's way of speaking to emphasize her point.
  4. Sangeeta and Salman's relationship lasted nearly a decade and was one of Bollywood's most adored couples.
  5. Despite their breakup, they managed to maintain a cordial and respectful bond.
  6. Sangeeta married cricketer Mohammad Azharuddin in 1996, and they finalized their divorce in 2019.
  7. Sangeeta and Salman remained in touch, showcasing their enduring friendship.
"Connections don‚Äôt break... Connections never go away. The love between your partners, school friends never goes away." - Sangeeta Bijlani

Conclusion: Sangeeta Bijlani shared a personal aspect of her past relationship with Salman Khan, revealing that he didn't allow her to wear short clothes. Despite their breakup, they maintained a friendly bond.
newTitle: Salman Khan Did Not Allow Sangeeta Bijlani to Wear Short Clothes, Actress Says She's No Longer Afraid

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a heartfelt New Year message, actor and film producer Shiva Rajkumar shared his immense gratitude after successfully battling cancer following surgery in the US.

  • Shiva Rajkumar underwent bladder cancer surgery in December 2024 at the Miami Cancer Institute.
  • He expressed fear prior to diagnosis but attributed his strength to the support of family, friends, and fans.
  • Rajkumar detailed his experience, acknowledging the challenges of chemotherapy and expressing gratitude for his medical team.
  • His wife, Geetha, confirmed the positive outcome of his treatment, stating he is officially cancer-free.
  • The actor expressed optimism about his recovery and plans to take care of himself moving forward.
  • The news of his recovery has significantly uplifted his fans, who had been praying for his health.
"I am eternally grateful for all your love and blessings. Happy New Year! #2025." - Shiva Rajkumar

This inspiring announcement has brought hope and joy not only to his fans but also to many who have faced similar health battles.

Is Chennai‚Äôs Margazhi Carnatic fest losing sheen? Empty halls, ageing fans, unpaid artists - ThePrint
summary:
Waning Enthusiasm for Chennai's Margazhi Carnatic Music Festival

Publication Date & Source: The Print, 29 December 2022

Chennai's annual Margazhi Carnatic music festival, once known for packed halls and NRI crowds, has seen a significant decline in attendance in recent years. The festival, which began on 15 December, was marked by empty halls and struggling organisers, raising concerns about the future of Carnatic music.

  1. Dwindling audiences: Despite the large audience base for Carnatic music, only around 7,000 people could attend the event, with most halls remaining empty except for a few top artists.
  2. Economic impact: The festival's economic contribution is decreasing, with only around Rs 1.68 crore from ticket sales, while canteen sales alone reach Rs 6 crore during the 45-day season.
  3. Artists' income: Many artists go unpaid for their performances, and the audience expects performances to be delivered to their doorstep, further straining the festival's finances.
  4. Lack of expansion: Carnatic music festivals are concentrated in specific areas of Chennai, and there's a lack of effort to expand the art form to other places, leading to a shrinking fan base.
Singer TM Krishna, who returned to the Music Academy after nearly a decade, expressed concern about the decline in music events across the city and stressed the need to revive and reimagine smaller sabhas to ensure Carnatic music's survival.

Also read: Meaningful art doesn‚Äôt have to be complex. Raihan Vadra-curated show defies the norm
newTitle: Waning Enthusiasm for Chennai's Margazhi Carnatic Music Festival

Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP Tejasvi Surya is reportedly set to marry renowned Carnatic singer Sivasri Skandaprasad in Bengaluru. Although there hasn't been an official announcement, the wedding is anticipated to take place on March 4, 2025.

Key Points:

  • Sivasri Skandaprasad is a renowned Carnatic singer and holds degrees in Bioengineering, Bharatanatyam, and Sanskrit.
  • She gained fame after PM Modi praised her 2014 devotional song on YouTube.
  • Sivasri has ventured into playback singing, contributing to films like 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part 1.'
  • Tejasvi Surya is a lawyer and currently serves as an MP for Bengaluru South.
  • Both share a passion for sports and physical endurance activities.
"This rendition by Sivasri Skandaprasad in Kannada beautifully highlights the spirit of devotion to Prabhu Shri Ram. Such efforts go a long way in preserving our rich cultural heritage," - PM Modi

In conclusion, the upcoming union between Sivasri Skandaprasad and Tejasvi Surya is generating interest, promising to meld cultural heritage with public service in a high-profile marriage.
